title: Tombi
description:
**Tombi** (È≥∂ `/to…¥bi/`) is a toolkit for TOML; providing a formatter/linter and language server.
See the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/tombi-toml/tombi) for more information.

toml-version.title: TOML version
toml-version.description: TOML version to use if not specified in the schema and comment directive.

include.title: File patterns to include
include.description:
The file match pattern to include in formatting and linting.
Supports glob pattern.

exclude.title: File patterns to exclude
exclude.description:
The file match pattern to exclude from formatting and linting.
Supports glob pattern.

anyOf.title: Formatter options
anyOf.description:
To avoid needless discussion of formatting rules,
we do not currently have a configuration item for formatting.

array-bracket-space-width.title: The number of spaces inside the brackets of a single line array.

array-comma-space-width.title: The number of spaces after the comma in a single line array.

date-time-delimiter.title: The delimiter between date and time
date-time-delimiter.description:
In accordance with [RFC 3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339), you can use `T` or space character between date and time.

- `T`: Example: `2001-01-01T00:00:00`
- `space`: Example: `2001-01-01 00:00:00`
- `preserve`: Preserve the original delimiter.

indent-style.title: The style of indentation
indent-style.description:
Whether to use spaces or tabs for indentation.

- `space`: Use spaces for indentation.
- `tab`: Use tabs for indentation.

indent-sub-tables.title: Whether to indent the sub-tables
indent-sub-tables.description:
If `true`, the sub-table will be indented.

```toml
[table]
    [table.sub-table]
        key = "value"
# ^^  <- this
```

indent-table-key-values.title: Whether to indent the table key-value pairs
indent-table-key-values.description:
If `true`, the table key-value pairs will be indented.

```toml
[table]
    key = "value"
# ^^  <- this
```

indent-width.title: The number of spaces per indentation level
indent-width.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è **WARNING** ‚ö†Ô∏è\
This option is only used when the indentation style is `space`.

inline-table-brace-space-width.title: The number of spaces inside the brackets of a single line inline table.

inline-table-comma-space-width.title: The number of spaces after the comma in a single line inline table.

key-value-equal-alignment.title: Whether to align the equal sign in the key-value pairs.
key-value-equal-alignment.description:
If `true`, the equal sign in the key-value pairs will be aligned.

‚ö†Ô∏è **WARNING** ‚ö†Ô∏è\
This feature does **not** apply to key-value pairs inside single line inline tables.

```toml
# BEFORE
key = "value1"
key2 = "value2"
key3.key4 = "value3"

# AFTER
key       = "value1"
key2      = "value2"
key3.key4 = "value3"
```

trailing-comment-alignment.title: Whether to align the trailing comments in the key-value pairs.
trailing-comment-alignment.description:
If `true`, the trailing comments in value/key-value pairs will be aligned.

**üìù NOTE üìù**\
The trailing comments of table header are not targeted by alignment.

```toml
# BEFORE
key = "value1"  # comment 1
key2 = "value2"  # comment 2
key3.key4 = "value3"  # comment 3

# AFTER
key = "value1"        # comment 1
key2 = "value2"       # comment 2
key3.key4 = "value3"  # comment 3
```

key-value-equal-space-width.title: The number of spaces after the equal in a key-value pair.

line-ending.title: The type of line ending
line-ending.description:
In TOML, the line ending must be either `LF` or `CRLF`.

- `lf`: Line Feed only (`\n`), common on Linux and macOS as well as inside git repos.
- `crlf`: Carriage Return Line Feed (`\r\n`), common on Windows.

line-width.title: The maximum line width
line-width.description: The formatter will try to keep lines within this width.

quote-style.title: The preferred quote character for strings

anyOf.description: The preferred quote character for strings.

trailing-comment-space-width.title: The number of spaces before the trailing comment.

key-empty.title: Key empty
key-empty.description:
Check if the key is empty.

```toml
# VALID BUT DISCOURAGED
"" = true
```

dotted-keys-out-of-order.title: Dotted keys out of order
dotted-keys-out-of-order.description:
Check if dotted keys are defined out of order.

```toml
# VALID BUT DISCOURAGED
apple.type = "fruit"
orange.type = "fruit"
apple.skin = "thin"
orange.skin = "thick"

# RECOMMENDED
apple.type = "fruit"
apple.skin = "thin"
orange.type = "fruit"
orange.skin = "thick"
```

tables-out-of-order.title: Tables out of order
tables-out-of-order.description:
Check if tables are defined out of order.

```toml
# VALID BUT DISCOURAGED
[fruit.apple]
[animal]
[fruit.orange]

# RECOMMENDED
[fruit.apple]
[fruit.orange]
[animal]
```

strict.title: Enable strict schema validation
strict.description:
If `additionalProperties` is not specified in the JSON Schema,
the strict mode treats it as `additionalProperties: false`,
which is different from the JSON Schema specification.

paths.title: The schema catalog path/url array
paths.description:
The catalog is evaluated after the schemas specified by [[schemas]].\
Schemas are loaded in order from the beginning of the catalog list.

items.description: Generic value that can be either single or multiple

anyOf.title: The schema for the root table

toml-version.title: The TOML version that the schema is available

include.title: The file match pattern of the schema
include.description:
The file match pattern to include the target to apply the schema.
Supports glob pattern.

anyOf.title: The schema for the sub value

root.title: The accessors to apply the sub schema

include.title: The file match pattern of the sub schema
include.description:
The file match pattern to include the target to apply the sub schema.
Supports glob pattern.

anyOf.title: The schema for the old sub value

include.title: The file match pattern of the sub schema
include.description:
The file match pattern to include the target to apply the sub schema.
Supports glob pattern.

include.title: File patterns to include
include.description:
The file match pattern to include in formatting and linting.
Supports glob pattern.

exclude.title: File patterns to exclude
exclude.description:
The file match pattern to exclude from formatting and linting.
Supports glob pattern.

FormatOptions.title: Formatter options
FormatOptions.description:
To avoid needless discussion of formatting rules,
we do not currently have a configuration item for formatting.
